text:
Hey guys,

I'm working on piece I'm really excited about, detailing how Product-Led Growth doesn't work exactly as it postulates:

 “...a go-to-market strategy that relies on using your product as the main vehicle to acquire customers...”

My argument is that what really drives SaaS businesses, and is more reliable vehicle to acquire users is "Product-led storytelling."

In my piece, I examined many SaaS brands and found the same pattern. I've also detailed how they're driving incredible growth (with stats, results, etc), using "Product-led Storytelling." Also, I selected these examples from enterprise level, growth stage, and early stage brands.

I found that being a product-led storytelling brand is more reliable to acquire customers than being product-led growth, based on the way it is defined.

My piece is currently under edit.

If you'd love to give it a look and make contributions, I'd welcome it.

Thanks.

text: Hey everyone! Happy Friday! I'm looking for some webinar co-hosts for 2 of our audiences. The first is Accountants (preferably QuickBooks certified) who enjoy helping small businesses out with technology recommendations. The second is small field services businesses eager to drive higher efficiency with software solutions. If we share either of these audiences I'd love to chat!
